channel.title: Macintosh Server Running (Staying On and Auto Server Reboot)
channel.description:
Hello!
I have had difficulty keeping my 317 server hosting on my MacBook without shutting down in an hour (if even that lucky). For a couple months, a person with a horrible Windows XP Desktop, that had about 4 GB Harddrive space left, hosted it. Even that caused shut downs after a few hours; though, that was expected.
I have a splendid Macintosh Desktop with 2.26Ghz, 4 GB Ram, and 1.07 Ghz Bus Speed (it needs to be upgraded to Snow Leopard to even host, so I have not tested it yet). I am willing to host a server 24/7 but this is where I need your help...how do I keep it running? If it's a desktop, does it tend to run more hours than a laptop? Assuming it won't continuously run, do any of you have a Terminal shell file that reboots the server every few hours like a "voule.bat?" Do you have advice or methods to keep it running?
If you need my server info to help me out, here's my server:
[url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,483617.0.html]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,483617.0.html [/url]
Thank You!
TheCyberMan
